page.title: 14 Birnbeck pier
page.content: With the decline of Weston-super- mare as a seaside resort and the new pier, Birnbeck pier became less popular.In 1933 a funfair was opened on the Grand pier and so people stopped using the ones on Birnbeck pier.It was finally sold privately. By 1979 the pier was threatened with dosure because of the bad state it was in.But it was done up,only to be hit by a dutch-owned pontoon causing about Â£700,000 worth of damage. Two new supports were put in and the pier was reopened to the public.In 1982 holiday homes were opened on the pier and today holiday makers can still stay there.
